Principal InvestigatorAngela M. Christiano, PhDColumbia University, NY, USA
Funding SourceR01AR056016-02National Institutes of Health (NIAMS), Bethesda, MD, USA
Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Genome Wide Association Studies in Alopecia Areata
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Genome Wide Association Studies in Alopecia Areata
Configuration.Description: 1054 unrelated alopecia areata patients were genotyped with the Illumina HumanHap550v3.0 genotyping chip. Allele frequencies were compared to publically available data from three population cohorts of controls.
Configuration.StudyInEx: All cases were ascertained through the National Alopecia Areata Registry and self-reported European ancestry. Only unrelated cases were included in the study.

Header.title: Funding Source
Header.Institution: National Institutes of Health (NIAMS), Bethesda, MD, USA

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: Use of the data must be related to Alopecia areata and related disorders. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). This dataset may be used for the study of alopecia areata and other autoimmune conditions associated with alopecia areata, including autoimmune thyroid disease, type 1 diabetes, vitiligo, rheumatoid arthritis, and celiac disease. Other appropriate use of data could include methodological development, study of fundamental biological processes that are known or suspected to underlie autoimmune diseases, and construction of analytic tools for end users.
